ReasonCode.title: ReasonCode
ReasonCode.description:
The reasonCode is expected to be used by the client to go to a content management system to determine some content that is to be displayed to the end user.
FIELD_REQUIRED:A field that is required was not provided.
INVALID_FORMAT:A field was provided but is in the wrong format.

HTTPStatusCategory.title: HTTPStatusCategory
HTTPStatusCategory.description:
Indicates the general category of failure
4XX_CLIENT_ERROR:
5XX_SERVER_ERROR:

field.description: The field whose value is not valid.

message.description:
The reason message is to be used by a developer trying to understand what a code means.

The message is not expected to be rendered to the end user.

id.description:
The id field is used to correlate errors across systems.
The id will be generated on the server and can be logged in the front end to allow a full end to end view of the sceneario involving the exception across multiple systems

code.description:
The code field is not the copy of the HTTP response.

The code field is likely to become an enum value with values that are common across all APIs.

message.description: Note that this value is not intended to be a customer facing message.  Customer facing messages should be derived from the through a mapping from the code value.  The code should be passed to a content management system to determine the content to display to the end user.  This allows the content to be managed separately from the life cycle of the application functionality.
